direction.raw_text: A dark, rumbling sky. Haze clings to the lake as we float across it, clearing to bring the opposite shoreline into view. A few scattered streetlights. Dilapidated cabins. An abandoned campsite. CAMP CRYSTAL LAKE. We continue to drift towards it, hearing the faint sound of seductive music and an occasional giggle. A small HOUSEBOAT floats into our foreground, its interior light flickering as TWO BODIES move around inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A teenage boy and girl, JIM and SUZY, are slow-dancing. Jim's lips softly touch her lissome shoulders.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well...how do you feel?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ask me in about five minutes. She bites his ear, giggles, then kisses him fully..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm talking about graduation. Being totally free to do whatever we want now. Her hands slip inside his Pendleton shirt. He sighs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It feels excellent. Her mouth finds his again. After a long kiss, he gently pulls away from her with a teasing smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gotta throw the anchor over. He leaves the cabin. She slips under the bed sheets.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as Jim tosses a small anchor overboard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as the weighty object splashes, sinking into black oblivion, pulling its cable down with it. JIM glances at the lake, at their eerie surroundings. He feels a chill, heading back inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . UNDERWATER - NIGHT (TANK) as the anchor drifts to the lake bottom, dropping a few feet from a THICK POWER CABLE which rests in the lake silt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as Jim returns with an uneasy expression. He crawls on top of the bed, kissing her again, but not with the same enthusiasm as before.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's wrong?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing. He starts to pull off his shirt and join her. She senses his anxiety.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: C'mon, Jimmy. Something's bothering you. Jim pauses, turning off the mood music.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's just that we're right around that old summer camp where all those murders took place. The boat creaks. She's instantly nervous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What murders?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Never mind, you don't want to know about it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's nothing to worry about, Suzy. The guy's dead now, somewhere at the bottom of this lake...if you believe the stories. (beat) Let's drop it, okay? He starts to kiss her again. She stops him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What stories? He doesn't want to go into it but Suzy's face insists.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There was this boy named Jason Voorhees who drowned in Crystal Lake...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eight year old JASON is desperately trying to tread water, flailing his arms like a marionette to get attention as he gulps down gallons of mossy lake water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hhhhelp....me....I'm drowning...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: None of the counselors heard him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mmmmmmommy.... ...And Jason finally slips under the surface for good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A bunch of years went by and everybody forgot about it. (beat) That's when the murders started.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as our senses are bombarded with QUICK CUTS of assorted teenagers just about to die, their screams echoing over each other. We do not see the attacker. As the cacophony reaches a screeching crescendo, CUT BACK TO:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as the silence hits us hard again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jason did it...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's what some people thought. But they were wrong.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as MRS. VOORHEES comes directly at camera wielding a huge knife and a primal scream.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His mother blamed the counselors for his death and tried to kill them all. (dramatic pause) She got her head chopped off by one of them. We don't need to see this clip...Suzy's reaction is quite sufficient.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So the murders stopped? He gives her a long, penetrating look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're bombarded with QUICK FLASHES of a hockey masked JASON wreaking havoc on assorted teenagers...brandishing everything from hatchets to knives to chainsaws. Just as Jason is about to stab us, CUT BACK TO:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suzy flinches as if she were getting the knife.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Legend has it that Jason came back to avenge his mother's death, vowing to kill every teenager from the area. (beat) And every now and then, the murders start up again. The boat lurches slightly, tugging at the anchor cable. She's scared: he's frightened himself a little, too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Forget about it, Suzy. They're just stories. He brushes her hair back, kissing her cheek gently, finding the nape of her neck again. She closes her eyes, trying to dismiss what he's dredged up. But she can't. Suzy begins to rationalize.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're the last graduating class, right? Jim's kissing her body, putting Jason behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I mean, Lakeview High just closed its doors for good, right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So there's no reason for him to come back because there won't be any of us around...right? Jim stops, looking her squarely in the eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right. Except that Jason isn't real so none of it matters anyway. She starts to relax, returning his kisses.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: RUSTY SET OF CHAINS TANGLED AROUND IT

direction.raw_text: . UNDERWATER - NIGHT (TANK) as the anchor drifts along the lake floor, tugging hard on the power cable. Camera TRACKS along the cable, coming to a RUSTY SET OF CHAINS TANGLED AROUND IT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as Jim slides on top of Suzy. Thoughts of Jason are starting to slip away along with their clothes.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: JASON IS SECURED BY THESE SAME CHAINS

direction.raw_text: . UNDERWATER - NIGHT (TANK) as the chains emit a dull tinkle due to movement from the tugging anchor. Camera continues to TRACK again...and we find to our horror that the waterlogged, fish-eaten body of JASON IS SECURED BY THESE SAME CHAINS. (NOTE: Jason's face is obscured.)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Teenagers in love, lost in not-so-innocent passion. At the same moment:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . UNDERWATER - NIGHT (TANK) The anchor tugs one last time and RIPS THROUGH THE CABLE. SPARKS INSTANTLY FLY, chasing along the cable, finding the chain which secures Jason and ENGULFING HIM IN ELECTRICITY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as BRIGHT FLASHES OF BLUE LIGHT strobe-under the surface. ARCING CURRENT chases up the anchor cable, sparking across the hoist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as the electricity feeding the streetlights is abruptly extinguished, plunging the campsite into darkness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as Suzy's eyes flash open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you hear that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hear what? He pulls her back down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: C'mon, I'm serious. He knows the mood is broken.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right, I'll check it out. He slips on his jeans, exiting the cabin. She pulls the sheet up around her fearfully.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . UNDERWATER - NIGHT (TANK) as the cable smolders, void of electricity now. TRACK to find the chains again...but they're dangling loosely. JASON IS GONE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suzy is tensely kneeling on the bed now. The black void of night is all she sees out the cabin door, which Jim has left open. An uncomfortable amount of time passes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jimmy...? No answer. Her heart starts to pound.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jim...? Again, nothing. She wraps herself in the sheet, moving towards the open door. The ship creaks again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as she grows closer to the doorway, nothing but pitch- black beyond it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop screwing around, Jim. I mean it... ...And just as she reaches the door:
direction.name: direction

result.heading: JASON PLUNGES THE KNIFE INTO HER CHEST

direction.raw_text: leaps out, clutching a HUGE KNIFE. Suzy barely has time to scream before JASON PLUNGES THE KNIFE INTO HER CHEST.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stands there in speechless shock, looking down at her mortal wound. But there's no blood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: pulls the knife back out, pushing the blade in and out with his hand. It's a retractable rubber knife. JIM pulls off the hockey mask with a huge grin, tossing it aside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gotcha good, baby cakes. She doesn't know whether to hug him with relief or kick him in the balls. He pulls her back onto the bed, laughing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sitting dormant on the deck, where Jim tossed it. A SHADOW FALLS ACROSS IT...followed by a SLIMY, DECOMPOSING HAND. The hand grabs it like it's an old friend, pulling it away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as Jim holds his angry girlfriend down on the bed, trying unsuccessfully to kiss her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right, all right -- I'm a major ass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you'll never do it again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And I'll never do it again. Forgive me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. She's resisting only for effect. Her legs curl around him, finally giving in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A deadly-sharp SPEAR GUN rests in its rack outside the cabin. JASON'S HAND REMOVES IT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The sheets begin to roll like waves as they work each other. Thoughts of Jason are nonexistent now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing there for a moment...then a pair of moss-covered BARE FEET SLOSH INTO FRAME.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: closes her eyes with pleasure...

direction.raw_text: ...and camera RISES from the mossy feet, up the bloodless legs and torso to ultimately reveal the hockey-masked face of our anti-hero: JASON VOORHEES.

direction.raw_text: lets out a broad smile, her eyelids fluttering. They stay open long enough to regard the visitor in the doorway. She tries to choke out a warning to Jim, who's just collapsed himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: JJJJJJJJason... He doesn't follow her glance, smiling instead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh-huh. You must really think I'm an ass. But she continues to stare in horror as:

direction.raw_text: raises the spear, taking aim.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hs starts to kiss her but she bolts up with a blood- curdling SCREAM. A second later, JASON FIRES THE SPEAR, PIERCING HER NECK, PINNING HER TO THE HEAD BOARD. Jim stares point-blank at his dead girlfriend, not able to assimilate it quickly enough. He spins around to see the monster himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ohmygod... Jim springs off the bed, looking around for anything to defend himself with, grabbing the bedside lamp. He SMASHES IT OVER JASON'S HEAD which has little effect. Jim scrambles to get past him, but Jason LIFTS JIM IN THE AIR, SLAMMING HIM DOWN ON ONE OF THE SPIKED BEDPOSTS.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: LIFTS JIM IN THE AIR, SLAMMING HIM DOWN ON ONE OF THE SPIKED BEDPOSTS

direction.raw_text: as the HOUSEBOAT silently drifts onward. The lone silhouette of Jason emerges from within, taking the helm. He's back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Only the faintest sign of daylight can be seen through a thick blanket of gray fog. In the distance, speckled lights outlining a smaller LUXURY CRUISE SHIP intermittently appear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Standing at the boarding ramp is CHARLES MCCULLOCH, clipboard in hand. He's just finished checking off a pair of new-agey SENIOR GIRLS. McCulloch is approaching fifty, wearing a tie and unwrinkled clothes, as well as the disposition of a stern puritan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Remember girls, the shuffleboard tournament will start at six p.m. sharp. A non-attendance will restrict your time in port, understood? They nod for his benefit, exchanging derogatory whispers as they head up the ramp. Camera ADJUSTS to find a small parking lot adjacent to the docks, where several cars are just now arriving -- parents dropping off their high school seniors, hugging them bon voyage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: R ANGLE PARKING LOT as SEAN ROBERTSON walks toward the ship with pal MILES WOLFE. Sean's a tall, nice looking, somewhat serious guy; Miles is shorter, athletic and more extroverted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're telling me this boat has a pool with a three meter board?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a ship and that's right. Plus a disco, gym, game room and a lot more.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think I'm gonna blow off New York and just stay on this thing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll do no such thing, Mr. Wolfe... Camera ADJUSTS to reveal McCulloch, holding his list, checking off their names.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your itinerary has been carefully planned and make no mistake, it will be executed accordingly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course...wouldn't want to risk enjoying this trip. McCulloch gives him a frown. Sean steps up to him tentatively.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Which cabin is Rennie in, Mr. McCulloch?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rennie's not coming. He's devastated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I thought...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She changed her mind. (eyeing list) Let's see...Mr. Wolfe is in stateroom one-eleven and you, Mr. Robertson, are in two-twenty-five. A booming VOICE from above interrupts them:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sean -- where the hell have you been? We're already into early departure protocol...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Standing on the upper deck is a no-nonsense, uniformed Navy man, ADMIRAL ROBERTSON. The captain of the ship. And Sean's father. Sean's sadness about Rennie's absence is immediately replaced with anxiety.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Be right up, Dad. He and Miles head up the gangway, both boys giving McCulloch one last glare.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Behind the wheel is MISS COLLEEN VAN DEUSEN, thirties, attractive, a progressive attitude. RENNIE WICKHAM sits next to her -- she's seventeen, pretty, slightly withdrawn. Rennie's dog TOBY, a border collie, rides in the back seat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm glad you decided to come after all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Me too. But I'm not sure Uncle Charles will be.

direction.raw_text: You let me worry about him, okay? (pause) Personal experiences are what fuel the minds of great writers, Rennie. You made the right decision.

direction.raw_text: What about not-so-great writers? Rennie smiles self-deprecatingly, Miss Van Deusen grinning back. But Rennie's smiles are few and far between, this one disappearing as she glances out the window.

direction.raw_text: as the countless gallons of harbor and lake water spread out before her, eery in the bog. A small ROWBOAT grazes across it occupied by two indistinguishable people.

direction.raw_text: Rennie's eyes show a hidden terror. She quickly turns away, shivering briefly. Miss Van Deusen notices. She turns a corner, heading into the parking lot.

direction.raw_text: Everything okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just felt a little chill. Rennie rubs her arms, faking coldness.

direction.raw_text: Did you know that I'm giving up teaching?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Since the school is closing anyway, I'm going to write that novel I've been threatening on everybody.

direction.raw_text: That's wonderful, Miss Van Deusen...what's it about? She parks the car, turning off the ignition.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A senior class cruise to Manhattan, laced with romance, adventure and murder. (beat) Or a Gothic cook book. I haven't decided which. She's coaxed the smile out of Rennie again. Miss Van Deusen pulls a small wrapped box from her glove compartment, handing it to Rennie, who seems utterly surprised.

direction.raw_text: Go on, open it. Rennie pops off the lid, revealing an antique ink-dip pen.

direction.raw_text: Stephen King supposedly used it when he was in high school.

direction.raw_text: I don't know what to say...

direction.raw_text: Rennie, you're the best student I ever had...you have a real gift. If anybody can make use of that pen, it's you. Rennie hugs her teacher. Camera RISES above the car's window, finding a Mercedes 560 SL pulling in a short distance away.

direction.raw_text: R ANGLE - MERCEDES A sexy, money-dressed blonde is behind the wheel. TAMARA MASON. She climbs from her leather seats as a trio of SENIOR GIRLS walk by, offering enthusiastic hi's and hellos. She's obviously Miss Popular. Tamara crosses to a cute Japanese girl unloading luggage from a beige Honda, EVA WATANABE. . TAMARA Are you ready for drugs, sex and rock 'n roll or what, girl? Eva gives her a warning glance, nodding to her left. Eva's MOTHER appears by the passenger door, forcing a smile at Tamara.

direction.raw_text: Hello, Tamara.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi, Mrs. Watanabe. Just kidding.

direction.raw_text: Yes, I'm sure. Embarrassed, Eva hurries to her Mom, rushing a kiss goodbye.

direction.raw_text: Don't worry about a thing, Mom. I'll have a terrific time and I won't do anything stupid, okay? Before Mrs. Watanabe can squeeze a word in, her daughter is gone. She waves a bittersweet goodbye to her graduate.

direction.raw_text: I love you...

direction.raw_text: Really?

direction.raw_text: R ANGLE - HOUSEBOAT Sure enough, it's the same one we saw JASON on last night...but no one is behind the helm. It seems to be a ghost ship.

direction.raw_text: as Tamara tries to slip past McCulloch, busy with another pair of seniors.

direction.raw_text: You can stop right there, Miss Mason. He motions the others onward. Busted. Tamara instantly hands Eva her drug-filled purse, paralyzing Eva.

direction.raw_text: What are you talking about?

direction.raw_text: Look, Mr. McCulloch, I got in a car accident yesterday and missed our appointment. It's okay, no big deal, just a bruised arm... (squeezes her arm) ...so I brought my project along today. It's in my suitcase. Really. He looks at her suitcase, not buying a word of this.

direction.raw_text: She's telling the truth, Mr. McCulloch. I saw her pack it. He's surprised to hear this...and so is Tamara.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right. But if it mysteriously disappears en route, I'll have you sent back home the minute we dock. Understood?

direction.raw_text: Perfectly. She grabs her purse back from Eva, quickly moving on before he changes his mind. Their voices become whispers.

direction.raw_text: What are you going to do?

direction.raw_text: Improvise, of course.

direction.raw_text: The window is splattered with blood, but still clear enough to make out Tamara and Eva walking up the gangway, along with a half dozen other teenagers mingling on board.

JASON SLIPPING OFF THE SIDE, FLOATING TOWARDS THE PILINGS

direction.raw_text: contract, her blood pumping faster. Then she hears a FAINT VOICE BELOW HER...

direction.raw_text: Yes Sir. (into intercom phone.) Take in the gangway and single up all lines.

direction.raw_text: and MILES enter the room; Sean gets a glance from his Dad. Miles is very impressed with the bridge.

direction.raw_text: Hello, Dad.

direction.raw_text: Hey, Admiral Robertson. Love your ship.

result.heading: SPLASHED WITH TOXIC WASTE, SEEPING INTO HIS MASK'S EYE SLITS

direction.raw_text: and his hockey mask is SPLASHED WITH TOXIC WASTE, SEEPING INTO HIS MASK'S EYE SLITS. He careens back as if her were a rabid dog receiving a load of point-blank buckshot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: drops the can, fumbling for the flashlight again.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: AS JASON TEARS OFF HIS MASK, EXPOSING HIS HIDEOUS FACE

direction.raw_text: UP - JASON (EFX) as the radiant flashlight beam finds his mask, the plastic beginning to bubble and melt. RUSH INTO A TIGHT CLOSE UP AS JASON TEARS OFF HIS MASK, EXPOSING HIS HIDEOUS FACE: rotted flesh, some of it sizzling from the chemical. Worms slithering out his nostrils. And his eyes...or lack thereof. They're like two raw quail eggs frying in liquid green pollutant...and the yolks just broke, running down his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as the beam begins to waver in her quivering grasp. RISE TO FIND RENNIE'S FACE, reacting to the stomach-turning sight of Jason's visage. She grabs hold of her senses and RUNS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as Rennie skirts past the blinded creature: WHIP PAN WITH HER as she turns down Tunnel #2, heading back toward Sean. CONTINUE TO QUICKLY PAN AROUND until we've come around 360 degrees and are back on JASON, in no way ready to give up. He staggers after Rennie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: #2 as Rennie skids up to Sean, still dazed. She grabs him, shaking hard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get up, Sean!!! His eyes blink, only half coherent. Then an inconceivable terror registers in her ears...A LOW, DEEP RUMBLING SOUND, COMING FROM UP AHEAD. Her head jerks in the direction of her planned retreat:
direction.name: direction

result.heading: LOW, DEEP RUMBLING SOUND, COMING FROM UP AHEAD

direction.raw_text: An ominously empty tunnel, soon to be filled with the unthinkable. The sound of RUSHING LIQUID is growing at leaps and bounds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as her trembling chin rises, looking at:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: #3 CEILING (EFX) The dim overhead lights are beginning to vibrate from the approaching flood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: rotates her head and sees:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: vision or no vision, he is lurching towards her relentlessly. She is literally sandwiched between hell and high water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: drags Sean to his feet with the strength of a possessed woman, pulling him over to a SERVICE LADDER attached to the intersecting alcove wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Climb!!! She shoves him up it from below, Sean summoning everything he's got to obey her. Rennie shoots a stare back down the tunnel...
direction.name: direction

result.heading: 180 DEGREES TO FIND JASON APPROACHING FROM THE OPPOSITE END,

direction.raw_text: The overhead lights are banging around like an earthquake has just hit; the liquid will be arriving any second. Her vision WHIP PANS 180 DEGREES TO FIND JASON APPROACHING FROM THE OPPOSITE END, groping around with his scaly arms like the claws of a roto-tiller.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as Rennie starts up after Sean, looking down and seeing:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: within ten feet of them, shifting directly for the ladder like he's working on some kind of radar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: slips on the rusty ladder, regaining her footing. and rushing higher. She takes her final glance into the tunnel, the ultimate horror registering in her corneas as she sees:
direction.name: direction

result.heading: FILLING THE TUNNEL, FLOODING STRAIGHT FOR CAMERA

direction.raw_text: #3 (MODEL EFX) A million gallons of green-brown toxic waste splash into the far intersection, FILLING THE TUNNEL, FLOODING STRAIGHT FOR CAMERA.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: has just started to climb the ladder when the wind and smell of the rushing toxic waste bombards him. His decomposed head swivels to face:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: #3 (MODEL EFX) Tons of lethal sewage, stopping for no one. Arriving in seconds.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: THE FIRST WORDS HE HAS EVER SPOKEN COME OUT, IN THE VOICE OF AN EIGHT YEAR OLD BOY

direction.raw_text: UP (EFX/FIBER OPTIC LENS) He doesn't need vision to confirm what his other senses already know. Jason's mouth begins to quaver...AND THE FIRST WORDS HE HAS EVER SPOKEN COME OUT, IN THE VOICE OF AN EIGHT YEAR OLD BOY:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mmmmmmmmmommy...DON'T LET ME DROWN, MOMMY... Camera speeds toward his gaping mouth and DOWN HIS THROAT as lightning arcs off his mucous covered insides. We sink deeper into his guts, fire and smoke flaring into our eves, eventually coming to a WELL IN THE PIT OF HIS STOMACH, FILLED WITH BLOOD...and EIGHT YEAR OLD JASON IS DROWNING IN IT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hhhhelp me.... A split second later:
direction.name: direction

result.heading: WELL IN THE PIT OF HIS STOMACH, FILLED WITH BLOOD

result.ToD: EIGHT YEAR OLD JASON IS DROWNING IN IT
result.heading: EIGHT YEAR OLD JASON IS DROWNING IN IT

direction.raw_text: #3 (EFX) (SLOW MOTION) The wall of deadly toxic liquid ENGULFS JASON.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: #3 - ON RENNIE AND SEAN (EFX) The powerful flood thrashes the ladder about two inches below Rennie's feet, the force of it fiercely shaking their rusty support. They are clinging to the ladder with their eyes squeezed shut. Praying for survival.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: #3 (MODEL EFX) We are drowning in a chunky cloud of sewage, rushing over and under us.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: CHIMES MIDNIGHT, HUGE BOLTS OF LIGHTNING CRACKING OVER MANHATTAN

direction.raw_text: The digital clock we saw earlier abruptly CHIMES MIDNIGHT, HUGE BOLTS OF LIGHTNING CRACKING OVER MANHATTAN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as the sewage level begins to drop. Rennie opens her eyes, glancing straight down and seeing.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: PAIR OF HANDS GRIPPING THE BOTTOM RUNG

direction.raw_text: The ladder beneath them reappears...which gives way to a PAIR OF HANDS GRIPPING THE BOTTOM RUNG. The liquid drops further, unshrouding the now-dead corpse of EIGHT YEAR OLD JASON. He's a relatively normal looking boy, probably the way he looked back in 1957...right when he drowned in Crystal Lake. Jason Voorhees has finally been put to rest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (N.Y.) Rennie and Sean stagger out from a side street, holding each other up...relief etched in their matured faces.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hear there's a statue here that's 22 stories tall. Rennie would smile if she could. She kisses his cheek. They amble on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...coming out from another alley, creeping up behind them through a crowd of pedestrians. About the height of a small child.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: walk arm in arm, exhausted and oblivious to their pursuer. But something, some innate perception causes Rennie to slow...and stop. Her eyes register a horrid fear and she WHIPS AROUND TO FACE...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! Limping on all fours, filthy with grease-matted fur. The whimpering dog crawls up to her, Rennie bending down, hugging her animal like she'll never let go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh Toby...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: CRANE SHOT (N.Y.) as Sean bends down too, ruffling the dog's fur, standing again with Rennie. The three survivors enter the collage of pedestrians, bright lights and skyscrapers. It is finally over.
direction.name: direction
